forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 52. West southwest wind around 12 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.shortForecast: Chance Light Rain then Mostly Sunny
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 11am. Mostly sunny. High near 60, with temperatures falling to around 58 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 12 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In the heart of Downtown San Francisco, the night breathes a cool whisper, marked by an occasional drop of rain that lingers unresolved. Clouds blanket the sky, casting a shroud over the lights of the city, while a gentle wind plays at about twelve miles per hour, punctuated by swift gusts that remind one of the bay’s ever-changing temperament. The expected low settles around fifty-two, beckoning a dress of light layers—perhaps a soft sweater under a windbreaker, to shield against the playful chill.

As dawn unfolds into Monday, the sun will chase the clouds away, promising a canvas of blue while the morning may still hold a hint of drizzle. Temperatures will reach a peak near sixty, though a cool breeze will usher in a gradual descent as the day progresses. Plans to explore a quaint café or wander through the cobblestone streets of the Embarcadero would suit the day well; one might take advantage of the clearer skies after the rain or indulge in a leisurely stroll near the waterfront, where the air is fresh and invigorating. Embrace the unpredictability of the weather; despite the early rain, the day will transform into one of those quintessential San Francisco experiences—dynamic, refreshing, and tinged with the spirit of exploration.
